Reviews.Title: “Lock up your Valuables”
Reviews.Author: BrenEnniscorthy
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing hotel, as although not expensive, it left a lot to be desired. The rooms were old & not well presented. Everything looked very dated & from the bathroom linen looking as having seen better days to bedrooms that were not appealing. the view from the room was into an apartment block, with people coming onto balconies or gardens to smoke. Breakfast was ok if you were up early, but if not what was on offer was not replenished quickly. Bar was very dis-appointing & did not live up to the photos on the website. The reception staff were very good & spoke excellent English & recommended some good restaurants & bars. Our room was raided & money was taken. When we informed reception, they told us that this happens on a no. of occasions, & that they themselves had also been attacked a couple of times. The safe deposit box only opens on a very limited basis & is in the reception area. I would not come back & would not recommend to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashutosh1109
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel in Berlin. This one you can keep on back of your mind as a fall back option. Ambience reminds you of some lodge not hotel but I must say rooms are big and clean. You can certainly save some euros for extra shopping with a little compromised stay here. Hotel connectivity is good with underground rail.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dark and worn down”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Frb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Savigny with my girlfriend in september 2011. We were intrigued by the description of Savigny as an historic hotel but we were terribly dissapointed. Its just OLD and ugly. The lobby is worn down and even the staff looks worn down. Very old people in very old uniforms. But I have to add: The were sweet and helpfull. When we got to our room we were shocked by the small size, the crappy furniture and worst of all the bed. IT WAS HORRIBLE!!! We asked to get another room and we got it. This was much nicer, but the beds were the same. Lumpy and bumpy and we slept awful. Next day we complained and we were offered another room, but still: LOUSY BEDS!!! We changed hotel later that day. The Hotel Sylter Hof was EXCELLENT! Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a find in an expensive country”
Reviews.Author: SurajitMitra
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and I was traveling with my aged parents. It was a wonderful stay. Housed in a pre-war era house complete with brass elevators, and high ceilings, it was a steal at Eur 60 pn for a triple with breakfast and free internet. The owners who run this place are extremely friendly and helpful. The old man is a war veteran from Iraq and was a pleasure to talk to. We had a problem with the bathroom door and within no time (inspite of being a Sunday), they got it fixed without a fuss. Breakfast was great.. simple and German.. lots of meat, cheese and juices. The german lady could not speak a word of english but understood our preferences easily. The location is bang opposite Konstanzerstrasse U Bahn and very very convenient to move around. There is a LIDL supermarket closeby where you can pick up some snacks & other stuff. The room was HUGE !! I mean massive.. I loved the place and my old parents did not have any problem with the hotel as well. Will surely visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “No one has mentioned the smoke...”
Reviews.Author: Pentictontraveler
Reviews.Content: I am surprised no one has mentioned the smell of tobacco smoke, which can be smelt from the street outside and is overwhelming when one opens the shabby brass door to this old, uncared for hotel. Once in the lobby, the smoke makes a non-smoker's eyes water and it does not subside when one goes to the room. Overnight, I opened the window for fresh air, but at 6am a waft of new tobacco smoke acted as an alarm clock in my room. I thought I had booked Sir FK Savigny Hotel, which is clean and new and nearby, with almost the same name. I was horrified when my taxi, given the address, dropped me at the shabby entrance to this run-down establishment. Others in the lobby also thought they had booked the other Savigny, which is brand new and clean. I called Eurobookings.com to complain but they insistedthat this was indeed the hotel I had booked online. I tried to find another hotel but the city was full, with two huge conventions in town. So I stayed four nights at the Savigny. On the plus side, the wifi and breakfast were included in the modest price, the sheets and pillows were white and clean, the bathroom likewise and the staff friendly and helpful. My room, which was reached by transit through a cleaning corridor with an old mop and a pile of aged rubbish on the staircase, was quiet. This is just another of many, many shabby budget hotels in Berlin, but OH THE SMOKE!

Reviews.Title: “Vile”
Reviews.Author: leb30
Reviews.Content: First impression, dirty, dull, depressing. Bathroom was like a cupboard and hairs on loo seat. Two sinks in bedroom made terrible noises all night. One bed on sitting on it. Felt generally unclean and kept socks on all the time so as not to make contact with floor. Although on top (4th) floor, could hear movement above us in the early hours. Definitely one place to avoid, although very central. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful noise problem!”
Reviews.Author: Calgacus
Reviews.Content: Escaped from our 3 month old baby and a traditional, quiet hotel sounded just the thing. They put us in a room just beyond the bar, the corridor had 5 guest rooms - and the bar toilets! Not surprisingly noisy at night, also woken at all hours of the night with constant banging doors. Only hotel I've been in where I've been woken in the morning by a football being kicked against the door! Asked to change rooms but told it was impossible, more like inconvenient. Spend a little more and go somewhere better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great good value hotel - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: grahamfin
Reviews.Content: We stopped for three nights from 11th October - as a group of 5 couples. Arrived late but hotel easy to find - only 300mtrs from underground. Very easy to get to from Schoenfeld airport. Staff very welcoming , helpful and friendly - the bar would stay open as long as we wanted! The hotel is quaint with an old fashioned feel. Rooms clean, if a little shabby - bathrooms are good. Breakfast is OK - bit on the basic side. We found some excellent restaurants close by. All in - a very good base for an enjoyable time in Berlin - at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Matt_G_London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not very central, but it is very affordably priced. The staff were friendly, courteous and most spoke good English. They also helped us organise restaurant reservations in the city. The breakfast buffet (included in the price) was generous. We stayed for a 'stag weekend' and so got back quite late each night - even so, we were met with a friendly welcome and a refreshing glass of beer at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “we left the hotel after one night”
Reviews.Author: barbyguy
Reviews.Content: we came to this hotel thinking it is in a central location. It isn't. taking a look at the pictures published by the hotel you get the feeling the rooms are very big. they aren't. The breakfast was great and the stuff are very friendly and helpfull. The hotel is very old but not looks good and also not so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the budget minded”
Reviews.Author: recceptl
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for two nights stay prior to departing from Tegal Airport. Overall rating was good quality. Excellent price based on the location (if memory serves we paid approx 60 Euro a night). Hotel was clean but "older". Large room but small washroom. No airconditioning. Hotel is located on a busy street. Reception spoke english well. Breakfast was good. Close to many amenities and 15 euro to the airport. One point to note is that if you are trying to get there by bus you should ensure that you have a map as the street which the hotel is located on changes names.

Reviews.Title: “For people who like being insulted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst staying at this otherwise unremarkable hotel, I came down to breakfast one morning and quietly proceeded to gather some food from the buffet, whereupon the chef suddenly appeared and began to reprimand me for using the 'wrong' size of plate for the sort of bread I wanted and the 'wrong' type of bowl for the sort of cereal I wanted. There were several sizes of both. This is local etiquette gone mad in an age of international hospitality. If Germany wants to enhance its reputation for customer service, it should not treat its 'guests' like they are characters in a Kafka novel who need to follow unwritten rules. I will not be staying here again.
